body_content.explanation: in a way that has some, but not complete authority, or that has been recognized officially by some, but not all authorities:
examples: The player was semi-officially suspended from the team until the police concluded their investigation into the accusations.
After her retirement, she semi-officially remained with the university in an advisory capacity.
I am only semiofficially representing the company here.

body_content.explanation: in a way that is known to be true but has not been announced publicly by someone in authority:
examples: The band semi-officially made it known that they were working on a new album when they released a short video clip.
On the first hot day of the year, the public pool was semi-officially opened to the public.
It was semiofficially estimated that the new taxes would bring in around £ 5 billion.
